user.title: Visionect Joan Server
user.description: Enter connection details for your Visionect server. You can use username/password or API key/secret.

abort.already_configured: This Visionect server is already configured.

views_menu.title: View Management
views_menu.description: Here you can define names for your favorite URLs (e.g., dashboards). This way, in services you can choose Living Room instead of entering a long http address.

settings.title: General Settings
settings.description: The integration generates temporary files (images, HTML). Here you specify how often they should be deleted to avoid clogging the Home Assistant disk.

data.cleanup_max_age_hours: Maximum file age (hours) - the file will be deleted after this time
data.tablet_language: Tablet Content Language (Auto = HA Language). If changed, run 'visionect_joan.clear_web_cache' with 'restart_session' checked.

error.name_exists: A view with this name already exists.
error.invalid_data: You must provide both name and URL.

set_url.name: Set Custom URL
set_url.description: Permanently changes the website or image displayed on the device screen. The set URL becomes the new Main view that the device will default to.

url.name: URL Address
url.description: Enter the full URL (starting with http:// or https://) you want to display. This can be a Home Assistant dashboard or any other website.

predefined_url.name: Select Predefined View
predefined_url.description: Choose one of the views you previously configured in the Integration Options. Allows for quick switching between favorite screens.

send_text.name: Send Text Message
send_text.description: Sends formatted text with an optional image to the device screen. This is a temporary view, perfect for notifications. Supports Jinja2 templates.

message.name: Message Content
message.description: Enter the text to display. You can use Jinja2 templates to dynamically insert data from Home Assistant, for example sensor states.

layout.name: Content Layout
layout.description: Choose how the image should be positioned relative to the text (e.g., image above text, beside text, etc.).

image_url.name: Image URL (Optional)
image_url.description: Link to an icon or photo to appear next to the text. For local HA files use format: http://HA_IP:8123/local/icon.png (upload file to //HA_IP/config/www/).

image_zoom.name: Image Zoom (%)
image_zoom.description: Adjust image size. 100% is original size, smaller values shrink, larger values enlarge the graphic.

text_color.name: Text Color
text_color.description: Select font color. E-ink screens typically support only Black and White.

background_color.name: Background Color
background_color.description: Select screen background color for this message. Usually White.

text_size.name: Font Size (px)
text_size.description: Define font size in pixels. Higher values mean larger and clearer text.

text_align.name: Text Alignment
text_align.description: Set text alignment: Left, Center, or Right.

font_family.name: Font Family
font_family.description: Choose a font style. Available fonts are optimized for readability on e-paper screens.

font_weight.name: Font Weight
font_weight.description: Choose whether text should be Bold or Normal.

small_screen_optimized.name: Optimization for Joan 6"
small_screen_optimized.description: Check this if using a 6-inch device (e.g., Joan 6). Adjusts margins and sizes to better fit content on screen.

action_webhook_id.name: Webhook ID (Right Button) (→)
action_webhook_id.description: ID of the webhook triggered when pressing the right button (arrow). Automatically detects internal address.

action_webhook_2_id.name: Webhook ID (Center Button) (✓)
action_webhook_2_id.description: ID of the webhook triggered when pressing the center button (check).

click_anywhere_to_action.name: Click Triggers Action
click_anywhere_to_action.description: If checked, hides other buttons. Touching ANY part of the screen will trigger the Right Button Webhook (→).

add_back_button.name: Show Back Button on Left (←)
add_back_button.description: Adds an exit/back button. For each device, configure the target in Views Configuration (Visionect Joan). To manage views: Settings, Devices and Services, Visionect Joan, Configure. Select Views menu.

click_anywhere_to_return.name: Click Triggers Back
click_anywhere_to_return.description: If checked, hides other buttons. Touching ANY part of the screen will trigger the Left Back Button (←).

back_button_url.name: Override Back Button Target
back_button_url.description: Highest priority. If you provide a URL or View Name here, the Back Button (←) will navigate there.

auto_return_seconds.name: Auto Return Back (seconds)
auto_return_seconds.description: Automatically closes the panel after time. Returns to the return target configured in device options.

set_display_rotation.name: Set Display Rotation
set_display_rotation.description: Changes the physical display orientation (Portrait/Landscape). Note: The device will reboot to apply the change, which may take a moment.

display_rotation.name: Rotation Angle
display_rotation.description: Select the desired screen rotation angle (0, 90, 180, or 270 degrees).

force_refresh.name: Force Screen Refresh
force_refresh.description: Sends a command to the device to wake up immediately (if possible) and fetch the latest image from the server. Useful when displayed content is stale.

clear_display.name: Clear Display (Flash)
clear_display.description: Forces a full screen refresh by flashing white/black. Used to remove ghosting artifacts that may appear on e-ink screens after long use.

sleep_device.name: Sleep Device
sleep_device.description: Forces the device to disconnect from Wi-Fi and enter deep sleep mode to save battery.

duration.name: Sleep Duration (seconds)
duration.description: Specify how long the device should sleep. After this time, it will wake up again to check for new tasks.

wake_device.name: Wake Device
wake_device.description: Attempts to wake up the device immediately. Works reliably only if the device is plugged in or configured in frequent listener mode.

send_qr_code.name: Send QR Code
send_qr_code.description: Generates a QR code from provided text (e.g., link, WiFi password) and displays it on the device.

data.name: Data to Encode
data.description: Text, URL, or WiFi config string to be converted into a QR code.

message.name: Text Message
message.description: Additional text displayed above or below the QR code, e.g., Scan to join WiFi.

qr_message_text_size.name: Text Size
qr_message_text_size.description: Font size for the text message.

qr_message_position.name: Message Position
qr_message_position.description: Choose whether text appears above or below the QR code.

box_size.name: QR Module Size
box_size.description: Determines the size of individual squares in the QR code. Increase for a physically larger code.

border.name: Margin (Border)
border.description: Thickness of the white border around the QR code.

fill_color.name: Code Color
fill_color.description: Color of the QR code elements (usually Black).

back_color.name: Background Color
back_color.description: Background color behind the QR code (usually White).

add_back_button.description: Adds an exit/back button. For each device, configure the target in Views Configuration (Visionect Joan).

click_anywhere_to_return.name: Click Triggers Back
click_anywhere_to_return.description: If checked, hides other buttons. Touching ANY part of the screen will trigger the Left Back Button (←).

back_button_url.name: Override Back Button Target
back_button_url.description: Highest priority. If you provide a URL or View Name here, the Back Button (←) will navigate there.

action_webhook_id.name: Webhook ID (Right Button) (→)
action_webhook_id.description: ID of the webhook triggered when pressing the right button (arrow).

action_webhook_2_id.name: Webhook ID (Center Button) (✓)
action_webhook_2_id.description: ID of the webhook triggered when pressing the center button (check).

auto_return_seconds.name: Auto Return Back (seconds)
auto_return_seconds.description: Automatically closes the panel after time. Returns to the return target configured in device options.

click_anywhere_to_action.name: Click Triggers Action
click_anywhere_to_action.description: If checked, hides other buttons. Touching ANY part of the screen will trigger the Right Button Webhook (→).
